17:46:03:15 A highway marker on U.S. 89A
17:46:09:09 commemorates a successful effort

909.text:
17:46:11:00 that for nearly 60 years did
17:46:13:12 just that.

913.text:
17:46:15:00 Lee's ferry.
17:46:17:12 Mormon pioneer john D. Lee came

918.text:
17:46:19:21 here in 1871.
17:46:21:12 He established a ferry service

922.text:
17:46:22:24 across the Colorado river at the
17:46:25:06 only natural point for 600

926.text:
17:46:27:15 miles.
17:46:29:09 Lee, seen here seated on his

930.text:
17:46:31:18 coffin, was executed in 1877 for
17:46:34:27 his role in the mountain meadows

935.text:
17:46:37:24 massacre, when 120 immigrants
17:46:40:21 heading to California were

939.text:
17:46:41:27 murdered in Utah.
17:46:43:00 The ferry operated for 52 more

946.text:
17:46:47:15 hikers, horses, wagons, and even
17:46:50:09 small automobiles across the

950.text:
17:46:51:18 river.
17:46:53:06 Only the railroad and finally

957.text:
17:46:58:03 Lee's ferry obsolete.
17:47:00:15 Today, the original Navajo

961.text:
17:47:03:15 bridge is reserved for
17:47:04:18 pedestrians, while the new

964.text:
17:47:05:27 Navajo bridge built beside it
in

966.text:
17:47:08:21 1995 caters to cars and trucks.
17:47:11:15 While the ferry itself is long

972.text:
17:47:13:06 gone, the name remains.
17:47:15:09 Lee's ferry is now the terminus

976.text:
17:47:17:03 for thousands of awe-struck
17:47:19:24 sightseers rafting on the mighty

980.text:
17:47:21:18 Colorado river.
17:47:25:00 >>> Several changes are being

985.text:
17:47:25:27 considered for Arizona's medical
17:47:27:09 marijuana program, including the

988.text:
17:47:28:15 possibility of allowing
17:47:29:24 post-traumatic stress disorder

990.text:
17:47:32:12 to be included as a qualifying
17:47:34:00 condition.

17:47:34:12 Arizona department of health
17:47:35:06 services director Will Humble

995.text:
17:47:36:15 joins us to discuss the
17:47:37:21 potential changes.

997.text:

17:47:40:09 >> Good evening.

999.text:
17:47:40:21 Thanks.
17:47:41:12 >> Why is it medical marijuana

1001.text:
17:47:42:21 approved for PTSD now?

17:47:47:03 law back in November of 2010,

17:47:51:06 debilitating medical conditions

1011.text:
17:47:52:21 that qualify people.
17:47:53:21 But inside the language of the

1014.text:
17:47:55:00 initiative was a provision that
17:47:58:06 said and, by the way, folks can

1019.text:
17:48:00:09 petition the department of
17:48:01:12 health services to add new

1022.text:
17:48:03:03 conditions over time.
17:48:04:15 So we built regulations around

1025.text:
17:48:06:18 the process by which people
17:48:08:00 could apply or basically

1029.text:
17:48:10:09 petition us to add new medical
17:48:12:03 conditions.

1031.text:
17:48:12:15 So PTSD wasn't on the original
17:48:14:09 list, but over the last however

1036.text:
17:48:17:15 long, three years, we've gotten
17:48:19:15 several petitions to add PTSD,

1040.text:
17:48:22:03 and this is the most recent
17:48:24:15 petition that's come through.

1044.text:
17:48:25:24 >> I know the lack of evidence
17:48:27:09 or the lack of research that it

1047.text:
17:48:28:24 really does help these folks is
17:48:30:15 a factor as far as you're

1051.text:

17:48:33:12 So we received a petition back

1054.text:
17:48:35:15 in October of 2013 to add PTSD
17:48:38:00 to the list.

1057.text:
17:48:39:03 We looked at the evidence, and
I

1060.text:
17:48:41:00 denied that petition back in
17:48:42:21 January of 2014.

1062.text:
17:48:44:15 There was a group of folks
17:48:45:24 called the cannabis nurses

1065.text:
17:48:47:00 association, who appealed my
17:48:51:03 decision, it's called an

1071.text:
17:48:52:24 appealable agency action.

1074.text:
17:48:55:27 administrative hearings and had
17:48:57:27 an administrative hearing about

1078.text:
17:48:59:03 that decision to not add PTSD
to

1080.text:
17:49:01:24 the list.

1083.text:
17:49:04:15 recommendation about a week or
17:49:06:09 so ago saying that we --

1087.text:
17:49:08:18 That I inappropriately denied
17:49:10:27 that petition because I didn't

17:49:12:18 consider some of the anecdotal
17:49:15:03 evidence that was presented

1095.text:
17:49:16:21 during the petition, and during
17:49:18:15 the hearing.

1098.text:
17:49:19:12 >> So that means now you
17:49:20:27 reconsider?

1100.text:
17:49:22:09 >> Right.
17:49:22:21 So it means that I have until

17:49:24:06 July 9th to reconsider that
17:49:25:27 decision from January, I have

1109.text:
17:49:30:03 recommendation, I could not take
17:49:31:21 it, or I could modify that

1112.text:
17:49:33:18 recommendation.
17:49:34:09 I haven't decided what I'm going

17:49:51:06 want to make sure I get this

1132.text:
17:49:54:03 initial decision to refuse to
17:49:55:18 include that, what was that

1140.text:
17:50:02:00 literature that it's helpful for

17:50:10:24 it is helpful for some people,

1157.text:
17:50:18:21 the symptoms for PTSD.

1163.text:
17:50:25:09 Not so much treatment, but
17:50:26:15 rather does it help at least

17:50:32:09 the symptoms of PTSD.
17:50:34:18 So it's really sort of a nuanced

17:50:37:24 distinction, but it's important.

17:50:41:03 like depression, and migraines,

17:50:46:15 >> Well, the appeal was just for

17:51:44:15 director would deny a petition,

17:51:48:12 appeal as soon as the new

17:51:51:27 So it's an Evergreen type of

17:51:55:24 which is, directors can't take

a

1321.text:
17:53:02:21 13 marijuana, and then there's

1324.text:
17:53:05:12 marijuana.
17:53:06:09 The there was a conflict between

17:53:19:06 around, you know, are lemon

1342.text:
17:53:23:27 for dispensaries to make and for

17:53:50:12 loop, because you smoke the

so
